description_txt: stated on February 21, 2011 in a question to Gov. Rick Scott.:
quote_txt: "State employees haven't received a raise in five or six years."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2011 in a speech in Cleveland, Ohio:
quote_txt: The president’s proposed budget "will help reduce the deficit by $400 billion over the next decade to the lowest level since Dwight Eisenhower was president."

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2011 in a statement to reporters:
quote_txt: Says Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker in his budget repair bill "is showing that no stone goes unturned as he asks everyone to tighten their belts."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2011 in in a TV interview, as well as other venues:
quote_txt: Hitler "abolished unions and that’s what" Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker is "doing today."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2011 in a press release.:
quote_txt: The House of Delegates budget bill "cuts $50 million from education."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: When it comes to urgency on passing a budget repair bill, "there’s no rush on this thing" because the fiscal year doesn’t end until June 30, 2011.

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Since Sherrod Brown and the Democrats "rammed" the economic stimulus bill through, "Ohio's unemployment rate has risen to 9.6 percent, above the national average."

description_txt: stated on January 13, 2011 in a newspaper article.:
quote_txt: Says families now pay out 40 percent of their income to taxes.

name_txt: Distilled Spirits Council of the United States
description_txt: stated on February 14, 2011 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: Sunday liquor sales could generate $3.4 million to $4.8 million a year in additional sales tax revenue for Georgia.

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2011 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: If Wisconsin's governor cuts perquisites as much as he plans to do, "it would still leave (workers) better off than their private sector" counterparts.

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2011 in an interview on "This Week with Christiane Amanpour.":
quote_txt: "The  firefighters, the policemen and others who supported (Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker) in his election bid ... don't have to worry about their collective bargaining rights."

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2011 in a mayoral debate:
quote_txt: A 2005 gay pride vote "had nothing to do with discrimination."

description_txt: stated on February 19, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: At protests in Wisconsin against proposed collective bargaining changes, "phony sick notes (were) passed out to excuse striking union members."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2011 in an interview on WCPN 90.3 FM:
quote_txt: "75 percent of the jobs created in the state of Ohio are created in small business. They are not created by huge corporations and those who are very wealthy."

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2011 in a column:
quote_txt: "Our children do not spend any time in school learning about our own U.S. Constitution."

description_txt: stated on February 11, 2011:
quote_txt: The federal government regulates the holes in Swiss cheese.

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a book:
quote_txt: Says some in Congress are trying "to create a separate government for those with a drop of Native Hawaiian blood."

description_txt: stated on February 3, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Lyme disease is one of the fastest growing infectious diseases in the United States, and Rhode Island has the second-highest incidence of this disease in the country."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • February 20, 2011

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Road construction bids "are coming in at the lowest in the modern era."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2011 in comment quoted in a column.:
quote_txt: "In Austin, I’ve got half-a-dozen or more schools on a list to be closed — one of which I presented a federal blue-ribbon award to for excellence. And several hundred school personnel on the list for possible terminations."

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2011 in an article in the Weekly Standard:
quote_txt: Oregon Health Plan rations "covered procedures under certain circumstances"

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Says under his budget-repair bill, "collective bargaining is fully intact."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in an appearance on a TV interview program:
quote_txt: Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker’s move to limit collective bargaining rights has led to "riots" at the Capitol -- "It's like Cairo has moved to Madison these days."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in a segment on her television talk show:
quote_txt: "Despite what you may have heard about Wisconsin’s finances, Wisconsin is on track to have a budget surplus this year."

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2011 in a press statement.:
quote_txt: On high-speed rail.

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: When it comes to taking cuts in tough budget times, Wisconsin "state workers haven’t had to sacrifice."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2011 in an interview on "The Laura Ingraham Show":
quote_txt: The government will "go out and buy my breast pump for my babies."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2011 in remarks on the Senate floor:
quote_txt: "We have 80,000 abortions in Texas every year."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2010 in a report:
quote_txt: Illegal immigration costs Georgia $2.4 billion a year

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2011:
quote_txt: "One of the biggest causes of our soaring debt and economic insecurity ends up being Pentagon spending. The budget for the Pentagon consumes more than half of our discretionary spending."
